intro: Psychotria morii, commonly known as the Morii Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in areas with high humidity and dense vegetation. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are typically consumed by various bird species. Psychotria morii is often found in the understory of rainforests, where it thrives in shaded, moist environments.
